Only believe, only be cheerful, only be of good courage. Let the disagreeables go. Turn from these things which cause sadness and which dishearten you. I will ever be true to you, and I want you to have no suspicion or distrust of me that I would say or do the least thing to hurt you or lessen 


                                    -369- 

the confidence of your brethren in you. Never, never will I do this. I will sustain and help you all I can. --Letter 41, 1874. 

Ellen G. White Estate Washington, D. C. Sept. 8, 1988. Entire Letter.
